prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Maggey Byrde
Description: A waitress at Tres Bien. Was found guilty of murder thanks to the phony me.
Character 5
Name: Jean Armstrong
Description: Tres Bien's owner and chef. A witness in the case who is also into aromatherapy.
Character 6
Name: Glen Elg
Description: The victim. Was a programmer. Maggey had apparently never even seen him before.
Character 7
Name: Victor Kudo
Description: Was in Tres Bien at the time of the incident. Has a thing for waitresses.
Character 8
Name: Lisa Basil
Description: The CEO of Blue Screens, Inc., and Glen Elg's boss. Absolutely not a robot.
Character 9
Name: Violetta → Viola Cadaverini
Description: Possibly part of the staff at Tender Lender? A thoroughly bitter person.
Character 10
Name: Furio Tigre
Description: The head of Tender Lender loan company. Also known as "The Tiger".
Character 11
Name: Bruto Cadaverini
Description: The head of the Cadaverini Family crime syndicate. Seems to live for his granddaughter.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts. On loan from Maya. Recovered in the kitchen of Tres Bien.
Evidence 2
Name: Magazine Clipping
Description: An article from December 5th. Says I was trounced and my client was found guilty.
Evidence 3
Name: Sports Paper
Description: Dates from December 3rd, the day of the incident. On it is a doodle that said 'MC Bomber' with an arrow pointing to '100,000' that was crossed out. 'Ahahahaha' and a laughing face are written next to it. Left by a costumer in Tres Bien on Dec. 3rd. Left by the victim. Doodle is in victim's handwriting.
Evidence 4
Name: Job Listings
Description: Picked up from a bench in Vitamin Square. Thrown away by the old man.
Evidence 5
Name: Lunch Special
Description: Tres Bien lunch special. Costs 20 dollars despite how unbelievably bad it tastes.
Evidence 6
Name: Small Bottle
Description: Found in the kitchen. Shape is different from the others bottles. Contents unknown. The victim's ear medicine. Found covered in unidentified fingerprints in the kitchen. The victim's ear medicine. Covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints.
Evidence 7
Name: Scooter
Description: Ridden by my phony. The wheel guard is all smashed up.
Evidence 8
Name: Jean's Loan Contract
Description: Jean's debt is half a million dollars. The owner of the loan is Tender Lender.
Evidence 9
Name: Victor's Note
Description: "Convicted before, a wicked man or woman, repeat offender -- Victor Kudo"
Evidence 10
Name: Glen's Autopsy Report
Description: Died of potassium cyanide poisoning. Time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM.
Evidence 11
Name: Tres Bien Floor Plans
Description: Blueprints of the crime scene. [caption] The view from the entrance is obstructed and could only see the patio.
Evidence 12
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the scene taken from near the kitchen. [caption] Two dining tables are separated by a folding screen. The one closer to the camera is empty. The other one is where the victim collapse on the table. There is an intact vase on each table. A coffee cup is knocked over and the the table cloth is stained by coffee. Near the coffee table are some pieces of papers. No one is sitting across from the victim.
Evidence 13
Name: Coffee Cup
Description: The coffee contained potassium cyanide. Covered in the victim and Maggey's fingerprints.
Evidence 14
Name: Victim's Lottery Ticket
Description: A winning ticket for half a million dollars. Found during a body search of Maggey.
Evidence 15
Name: Apron
Description: Worn by Maggey at the time of the incident. Has small pockets but big stains.
Evidence 16
Name: Potassium Cyanide
Description: A deadly powdery poison. Bears Maggey's fingerprints. Found in her apron pocket.
Evidence 17
Name: Victim's Prescription Bag
Description: The victim got this from the doctor before going to Tres Bien. The bag is empty.
Evidence 18
Name: Victor's Testimony
Description: "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."
Evidence 19
Name: Millionaire Radio Flyer
Description: Experience the most thrilling ten minutes of your life every Monday at 1:30 PM!
Evidence 20
Name: Glen's Calendar
Description: On Dec. 3rd, the day of the incident, there is a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger".
Evidence 21
Name: Losing Horse Racing Tickets
Description: Horse racing betting tickets. Found in Glen Elg's desk. There's over 500 of them!
Evidence 22
Name: Gumshoe's Lunchbox
Description: A tenderly handmade lunchbox. Fills the stomach with love and plenty of weenies.
Evidence 23
Name: MC Bomber
Description: Found at Tender Lender. A sample disc with the name written in marker. Found at Tender Lender. Contains a computer virus program. A computer virus made by Glen Elg. Potentially worth million of dollars.
Evidence 24
Name: Tres Bien Matches
Description: Matches used for advertising. Found lying in Tender Lender.
Evidence 25
Name: Repair Bill
Description: A car repair bill for $15,000. Paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family.
Evidence 26
Name: Paper Badge
Description: Found at Tender Lender. Made of cardboard and painted to look authentic.
Evidence 27
Name: Viola's Medical Papers
Description: A 1 million dollar bill for cranial surgery. Payment was due last year.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: La mirror, it was in z'e middle of la restaurant, dividing z'e two 'alves.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 1
Testimony: Z'ere is only one seat from which you could 'ave seen an image of la victim.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 2
Testimony: Z'at was la seat at z'e table next to la victim's. Z'at was where la old man was sitting.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 3
Testimony: After la terrible incident occurred, I move la mirror so it was not in z'e way.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 4
Testimony: But naturally, I did not touch anything else!
Person: Armstrong

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. So, we have a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and we need to find which evidence contradicts which testimony. The answer should be a pair of one evidence and one testimony that conflict with each other. Let's start by understanding the testimonies given and then check the evidences to see if any contradictions exist.

Looking at the testimonies, all of them are from Armstrong (Character 5). Let's go through each one:

Testimony 0: He mentions a mirror in the middle of the restaurant dividing the two halves. So, there was a mirror acting as a divider. 

Testimony 1: He says there's only one seat from which you could see an image of the victim. That seat is next to the victim's table where an old man was sitting (Testimony 2). 

Testimony 3: After the incident, Armstrong moved the mirror so it wasn't in the way. But he claims he didn't touch anything else (Testimony 4).

Now, looking at the evidence. Let's check each one related to the layout of Tres Bien or the mirror. Evidence 11 is the Tres Bien Floor Plans. The caption says the view from the entrance is obstructed and could only see the patio. Then there's Evidence 12, the Crime Photo, which shows two tables separated by a folding screen. The victim's table is behind the screen. The photo was taken near the kitchen. The empty table is closer to the camera. Also, the vase on each table is intact, but Victor's Testimony (18) mentions he broke the vase at his seat. Wait, but that's Victor's testimony, not Armstrong's.

Wait, Armstrong's testimonies talk about a mirror, but the Crime Photo (Evidence 12) mentions a folding screen separating the tables. That seems contradictory. Because Testimony 0 from Armstrong says there was a mirror dividing the restaurant, but the Crime Photo shows a folding screen instead. So if the floor plans (Evidence 11) say that the view from the entrance is obstructed (maybe by the screen?), but Armstrong says there was a mirror. That could be a contradiction. 

Wait, let me check the exact details. Testimony 0: Armstrong says "La mirror, it was in z'e middle of la restaurant, dividing z'e two 'alves." But the Crime Photo (Evidence 12) shows two tables separated by a folding screen. So if there was a mirror dividing the restaurant, but the crime scene photo shows a folding screen, that's a contradiction. Unless the mirror and the folding screen are the same thing, but that's unlikely. Alternatively, maybe Armstrong is lying about the mirror being there. 

Wait, the floor plans (Evidence 11) also mention that the view from the entrance is obstructed, which could be by the folding screen as per the Crime Photo. But Armstrong claims there's a mirror. So the evidence from the floor plans and crime photo contradict Armstrong's testimony about the mirror. So the contradiction here is between Armstrong's Testimony 0 (about the mirror) and Evidence 12 (Crime Photo showing a folding screen instead of a mirror). Alternatively, maybe the mirror was moved. But Testimony 3 says Armstrong moved the mirror after the incident, but the Crime Photo is taken during the incident. So if the photo shows a folding screen, then the mirror wasn't there at the time of the crime, contradicting Testimony 0. Therefore, Evidence 12 (Crime Photo) contradicts Testimony 0 (mirror in the middle). 

But wait, Testimony 3 says Armstrong moved the mirror after the incident. So during the incident, the mirror was there, and after he moved it. The Crime Photo is taken from near the kitchen, showing the scene as it was during the crime. If the photo shows a folding screen instead of a mirror, then Armstrong's Testimony 0 is contradicted. Alternatively, perhaps the mirror was part of the screen. But the description of the Crime Photo says "Two dining tables are separated by a folding screen." So there's a folding screen, not a mirror. Therefore, Armstrong's Testimony 0 about the mirror being in the middle contradicts Evidence 12's Crime Photo, which shows a folding screen. 

Another angle: Testimony 1 says only one seat could see the victim's image via the mirror. But if the mirror wasn't there and instead a folding screen, then that seat wouldn't have a view. So maybe the mirror wasn't present, hence no reflection. Therefore, the contradiction is between Armstrong's testimony about the mirror and the actual presence of a folding screen in the Crime Photo. 

Therefore, Evidence 12 (Crime Photo) contradicts Testimony 0 (mirror in the middle). But let me check if there's another possible contradiction. 

Looking at Testimony 3, Armstrong says he moved the mirror after the incident. But if the mirror was moved, then the Crime Photo, taken after the incident, would show the mirror not in the way. However, the Crime Photo's caption says "taken from near the kitchen" and the scene as it was when the victim collapsed. So the photo is of the crime scene as it was during the incident. Therefore, if Armstrong moved the mirror after the incident, the photo would have the mirror in place during the incident. But the photo shows a folding screen instead. Therefore, Armstrong's claim that there was a mirror (Testimony 0) is contradicted by Evidence 12 (Crime Photo) showing a folding screen. 

Alternatively, perhaps the mirror was part of the folding screen. But the description of the Crime Photo doesn't mention a mirror. So the contradiction is between Testimony 0 (mirror present) and Evidence 12 (folding screen present). 

Therefore, the correct pair is Evidence 12 and Testimony 0. Wait, but let me check the evidence numbers again. 

Evidence 12 is the Crime Photo. Testimony 0 is the first testimony from Armstrong about the mirror. So the answer would be {"evidence": 12, "testimony": 0}. 

But wait, let's check other possibilities. For example, Testimony 3 says Armstrong moved the mirror after the incident. But if the mirror was moved, then the floor plans (Evidence 11) might show something else. Evidence 11's caption says the view from the entrance is obstructed and could only see the patio. The floor plans are blueprints, so they might show the original layout, which could include the folding screen. Wait, but Armstrong's testimony says there was a mirror, which might not be on the blueprints. Hmm. Alternatively, if the mirror was a temporary addition, not part of the original floor plan, then the blueprints wouldn't show it. But the contradiction is between the actual crime scene photo (Evidence 12) showing a folding screen and Armstrong's Testimony 0 claiming a mirror was there. That's the contradiction. Therefore, the pair is Evidence 12 and Testimony 0.

Person: Armstrong
Testimony 4
Testimony: When 'e got word 'e won la lottery, Mon. Elg became very excited.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was approximately 5 minutes later z'at la poisoning incident occurred.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 6
Testimony: Non, z'ere was no time for a phony to do la acting.
Person: Armstrong

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let's start by going through the testimonies and checking them against the evidences.

First, Testimony 0 by Armstrong says that the victim, Glen Elg, came to the restaurant alone. Then Testimony 1 and 2 mention that an old man arrived not long after him, just after 2 PM. Testimony 3 says there were no other customers. So according to Armstrong, the only people there were Glen Elg and the old man. But wait, there's Victor Kudo (Character 7) who was in Tres Bien at the time of the incident. So Victor's presence contradicts Testimony 3 which states there were no other customers. But looking at Evidence 9, Victor's Note might not directly address that. Wait, Evidence 18 is Victor's Testimony where he says he broke the vase at his seat. So Victor was present, which means Armstrong's Testimony 3 claiming no other customers is false. Therefore, Testimony 3 ("Z'ere were no other customers.") is contradicted by Victor's Testimony (Evidence 18) or perhaps another evidence showing Victor was there. But in the list of characters, Victor Kudo was present. However, the testimonies are from Armstrong, so maybe he's lying or mistaken. The evidence that shows Victor was there is Victor's own testimony (Evidence 18) where he mentions breaking a vase. That directly contradicts Armstrong's Testimony 3 which says there were no other customers. So the pair would be Evidence 18 (Victor's Testimony) contradicting Testimony 3. Wait, but the question asks for evidence and testimony that contradict each other. So the testimony is Armstrong's Testimony 3, and the evidence is Victor's Testimony (Evidence 18). Therefore, that's the contradiction.

Testimony 0
Testimony: I don't know nothin' about no murder.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 1
Testimony: I was tied up with business in December last year. Spent all'a my time in my office.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 2
Testimony: The day youse talkin' about, I was in de office, too. I never saw that kid before.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 3
Testimony: I got whales lined up to borrow cash from Tender Lender every single day.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 4
Testimony: Youse wanna check my alibi, just ask Violetta.
Person: Tigre

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let me start by going through each testimony and cross-referencing with the evidences.

First, looking at the testimonies from Tigre. Testimony 2 says, "The day youse talkin' about, I was in de office, too. I never saw that kid before." The day in question is December 3rd, the day of the incident. Now, looking at the evidence list, Evidence 20 is Glen's Calendar, which has a note on Dec. 3rd: "Meet with The Tiger." "The Tiger" is Furio Tigre's nickname, as mentioned in his description (Character 10). So if Tigre claims he was in his office all day and never saw Glen Elg (the victim), but the victim had a meeting scheduled with him that day, that's a contradiction. 

Additionally, Evidence 6 (Small Bottle) mentions that the victim's ear medicine was found with Tigre's fingerprints. If Tigre never met the victim, how did his fingerprints get on the victim's medicine? That also contradicts his testimony. But maybe the key contradiction is between Testimony 2 and Evidence 20, since the calendar directly indicates a meeting that Tigre denies.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find a contradiction between one of the evidences and one of the testimonies. Let me start by going through each testimony and see if any of them clash with the evidence provided.

Looking at the testimonies from Tigre (Testimonies 0 to 4). Let's check each one against the evidence.

Testimony 0: Tigre says he never met Glen Elg. But Evidence 20 is Glen's Calendar, which notes a meeting with "The Tiger" on Dec 3rd. Since Tigre is known as "The Tiger" (Evidence 10), this suggests they had a meeting scheduled. So Testimony 0 might be contradicted by Evidence 20.

Testimony 1: Tigre mentions a guy wanting to borrow cash. Evidence 8 is Jean's loan contract with Tender Lender, but that's about Jean, not Glen. Not sure if this contradicts anything.

Testimony 2: He set up a meeting at his office. Evidence 20's calendar note aligns with this, so no contradiction here.

Testimony 3: He waited but Glen didn't show. However, Evidence 3 (Sports Paper) has a doodle from the victim mentioning 'MC Bomber' and the meeting might relate to that. Also, Evidence 23 (MC Bomber) was found at Tender Lender, suggesting Glen was there. Wait, Evidence 23 is a computer virus made by Glen found at Tender Lender. If Glen didn't show up (per Tigre's Testimony 3), how did the disc get there? So maybe Evidence 23 contradicts Testimony 3. Because if Glen didn't come, why is his disc there?

Alternatively, Evidence 20 (Glen's Calendar) shows he had a meeting with The Tiger (Tigre) on the day. If Tigre says Glen didn't show, but maybe the meeting actually happened. Also, Evidence 3 is a sports paper from Dec 3rd (the day of the incident) with a doodle by the victim. The doodle has 'MC Bomber' linked to 100,000 crossed out, and 'ahahaha'—maybe indicating a deal or something. If Tigre claims Glen never showed, but the meeting actually took place, leading to the creation of MC Bomber (Evidence 23), then Testimony 3 is contradicted by Evidence 23. Alternatively, Evidence 24 (Tres Bien matches found at Tender Lender) could indicate someone from Tres Bien was there. Wait, but Tigre's Testimony 4 says he's never been to Tres Bien. But Evidence 24 is matches from Tres Bien found at Tender Lender, which is Tigre's place. So that would mean someone brought the matches there. If Tigre was at Tres Bien, he could have the matches, but he says he's never been there (Testimony 4). So Evidence 24 contradicts Testimony 4. Let's check.

Testimony 4: "I ain't never been to that Tres Bien joint." But Evidence 24 is Tres Bien Matches found at Tender Lender. If the matches are from Tres Bien and are in Tigre's office, that suggests someone from Tres Bien was there, possibly Tigre himself. So if Tigre claims he's never been to Tres Bien, but the matches from Tres Bien are at his place, that's a contradiction. Alternatively, maybe someone else brought them, but he could have obtained them without going there. Hmm. But it's a possible contradiction.

Another angle: Evidence 6 (Small Bottle) has Furio Tigre's fingerprints. The bottle was found in the kitchen of Tres Bien. If Tigre's fingerprints are on it, that means he handled the bottle, implying he was in Tres Bien's kitchen. But his Testimony 4 says he's never been to Tres Bien. So Evidence 6 (which has his fingerprints) contradicts Testimony 4. Because if he was never there, how did his fingerprints get on the bottle in the kitchen?

Yes, that's a solid contradiction. The Small Bottle (Evidence 6) was found in Tres Bien's kitchen with Tigre's fingerprints. But Tigre's Testimony 4 claims he's never been there. So those two contradict each other. So the answer would be Evidence 6 and Testimony 4.

Wait, let me confirm. Evidence 6's description: Found in the kitchen. Covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints. So the presence of his fingerprints in Tres Bien's kitchen implies he was there, which directly contradicts his statement in Testimony 4. That's a clear contradiction.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. First, I need to find which evidence contradicts one of the testimonies provided. The user wants only one pair, so I need to look through each testimony and cross-reference with the evidence list to find inconsistencies.

Starting with the testimonies from Tigre. There are four of them. Let's go through each one.

Testimony 0: Tigre says he was supposed to meet "the kid" at the restaurant that afternoon. Looking at the evidence, Evidence 20 is Glen's Calendar which mentions a meeting with "The Tiger" on Dec 3rd. Since Tigre is known as "The Tiger", this suggests that Glen (the victim) was supposed to meet Tigre. So this testimony aligns with Evidence 20, no contradiction here.

Testimony 1: Tigre claims when he opened the door, he saw an ugly scene. Evidence 11 (Tres Bien Floor Plans) mentions that the view from the entrance is obstructed and could only see the patio. If the view was obstructed, how could Tigre see the scene immediately upon opening the door? That could be a contradiction. Let me check the details. The floor plans state the entrance's view is obstructed, so Tigre's statement about seeing the scene upon entering might conflict with this. But maybe he entered further? Not sure yet. Let's hold onto that thought.

Testimony 2: Tigre says the guy was laid out over the table, stiff. The autopsy report (Evidence 10) says death by cyanide, which can cause rapid death but stiffness (rigor mortis) sets in later. However, the time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM. If Tigre arrived shortly after, rigor mortis might not have set in yet. But this might not be a direct contradiction with any evidence. The Crime Photo (Evidence 12) shows the victim collapsed on the table, which matches the description. So maybe no contradiction here.

Testimony 3: Tigre says he figured the place would be hot, so he left. Then in Testimony 4, he heard sirens on his way out and went back to his office. Now looking at Evidence 6, the Small Bottle, which is the victim's ear medicine but has Furio Tigre's fingerprints. If Tigre was at the scene, his fingerprints on the bottle would contradict his claim that he left immediately and went straight back. Because if he left immediately without touching anything, how did his fingerprints get on the bottle found in the kitchen?

Wait, let's check Evidence 6 again. It says the Small Bottle was found in the kitchen, covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints. So if Tigre claims he left the scene quickly (Testimony 3 and 4), how did he leave his fingerprints there? Unless he had prior contact with the bottle. But according to Evidence 6, the bottle is the victim's ear medicine. If Tigre met with the victim, maybe he handled the bottle during their meeting. But if Tigre's testimony says he left immediately upon seeing the body and hearing sirens, but his fingerprints are on the victim's medicine bottle in the kitchen, that's a contradiction. Because he shouldn't have had time to handle the bottle unless he was in the kitchen, which his testimony doesn't mention. So Evidence 6 (fingerprints) contradicts Testimony 3 (he left immediately without being in the kitchen). Alternatively, Testimony 4's claim that he went straight back to his office, but his fingerprints are on an item at the crime scene.

So the contradiction here would be between Tigre's Testimony 3 (leaving immediately) and Evidence 6 (his fingerprints on the bottle in the kitchen). Therefore, the evidence and testimony that contradict each other are Evidence 6 and Testimony 3 or 4. Wait, Testimony 3 says he left because the place was going to be hot, and Testimony 4 says he heard sirens while leaving. So the act of leaving would be after the crime. But his fingerprints being on the victim's medicine bottle suggests he was in the kitchen, which isn't accounted for in his testimonies. Therefore, the contradiction is that he couldn't have left immediately without being in the kitchen, but his fingerprints are there.

So the correct pair is Evidence 6 (Small Bottle with Tigre's fingerprints) and Testimony 3 (Tigre saying he left immediately). Alternatively, Testimony 4 might also be involved, but the key contradiction is that he was present at the scene long enough to handle the bottle. So the testimony that he left before the police arrived (Testimony 3) and the evidence that his fingerprints are on the bottle in the kitchen. Therefore, the answer is {"evidence": 6, "testimony": 3}.

cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let's start by looking at the testimonies from Tigre and cross-referencing them with the evidence.

Testimony 3 from Tigre says: "I'm about to flatten the guy, when he starts screamin'." So he was threatening Glen Elg because he couldn't pay back the loan. But then Glen supposedly won the lottery, which made everything okay. But wait, Evidence 3 is the sports paper with a doodle that says 'MC Bomber' pointing to 100,000 crossed out and 'Ahahahaha'. The victim wrote that. Also, Evidence 23 is MC Bomber, a computer virus made by Glen. The sports paper's doodle suggests that Glen had some plan related to MC Bomber and the 100k. If Tigre was just after the 100k, but Glen had this virus worth millions, maybe Tigre had a bigger motive. But according to Testimony 7, Tigre says he only wanted the 100k and had no other reason. But if the MC Bomber was worth millions, Tigre might have wanted that instead, contradicting his testimony. Alternatively, let's check Evidence 20: Glen's calendar notes a meeting with "The Tiger" (Tigre) on the day of the incident. Also, Evidence 3's doodle from the victim shows the 100k crossed out and laughter, implying maybe he didn't need to pay because he had another plan (the virus). If Tigre knew about the virus, his claim of only wanting 100k would be contradicted. But Evidence 23 says the virus was found at Tender Lender, and Tigre paid for Viola's surgery. Wait, the testimonies from Tigre mention the 100k loan, but if the victim had a lottery ticket worth half a million (Evidence 14), which was found on Maggey, that's more than the 100k. But Tigre's testimony 4 says Glen won half a million, so he let him go. But Evidence 14 shows the ticket was on Maggey, which might be a setup.
